instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 12" Liquid damaged. SSD not detect.
threads.message:
Hi 
This is a liquid damged board tiny bit around <RESISTOR>R9030</RESISTOR> , P2V7NAND area. I replaced the <RESISTOR>R9030</RESISTOR> as it was covered with dirt. <SIGNAL>PP2V7_NAND_VCC</SIGNAL> is 5v in <CAPACITOR>C9022</CAPACITOR> and  BURNT TP other side of the board near L9000.
<CHIP>U9000</CHIP> PIN 15 EN signal <SIGNAL>PICCOLO_VEN1</SIGNAL> Is missing. 
IN <TRANSISTOR>Q9001</TRANSISTOR> PIN 1,2 i get 8.7v. I get nothing from ll the other pins.

Any advice really appreciate .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 12" Liquid damaged. SSD not detect.
threads.message:
I do not recommend to waste time on it.
If you have time, put good flux and reflow SSD area...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 12" Liquid damaged. SSD not detect.
threads.message:
Hi, this is solved. Found missing <SIGNAL>PICCOLO_IUVD</SIGNAL>. FOUND THERE IS NO <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> ON <RESISTOR>R9350</RESISTOR> which create this rail. Bad trace on pin1 <RESISTOR>R9350</RESISTOR>. ran a wire from PPBUS and got ssd working.
It was difficult to access <RESISTOR>R9350</RESISTOR> so i removed the  cover shield. Thanks again for your help.
